metadata.title: CVE-2022-26562 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS-updates 20.04 LTS (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
An issue in provider/libserver/ECKrbAuth.cpp of Kopano Core <= v11.0.2.51contains an issue which allows attackers to authenticate even if the useraccount or password is expired. It also exists in the predecessor ZarafaCollaboration Platform (ZCP) in provider/libserver/ECPamAuth.cpp of Zarafa>= 6.30 (introduced between 6.30.0 RC1e and 6.30.8 final).

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-26562` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

kopano-archiver - 8.7.0-7ubuntu1.1
kopano-backup - 8.7.0-7ubuntu1.1
kopano-common - 8.7.0-7ubuntu1.1
kopano-contacts - 8.7.0-7ubuntu1.1
kopano-core - 8.7.0-7ubuntu1.1
kopano-dagent - 8.7.0-7ubuntu1.1
kopano-gateway - 8.7.0-7ubuntu1.1
kopano-ical - 8.7.0-7ubuntu1.1
kopano-l10n - 8.7.0-7ubuntu1.1
kopano-libs - 8.7.0-7ubuntu1.1
kopano-monitor - 8.7.0-7ubuntu1.1
kopano-presence - 8.7.0-7ubuntu1.1
kopano-search - 8.7.0-7ubuntu1.1
kopano-server - 8.7.0-7ubuntu1.1
kopano-spamd - 8.7.0-7ubuntu1.1
kopano-spooler - 8.7.0-7ubuntu1.1
kopano-utils - 8.7.0-7ubuntu1.1
php-mapi - 8.7.0-7ubuntu1.1
python3-kopano - 8.7.0-7ubuntu1.1
python3-mapi - 8.7.0-7ubuntu1.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: kopanocore package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '8.7.0-7ubuntu1.1').
